content:
1. Visionary: Leaders who are inspirational and motivate their team have a clear vision of where they want to go and articulate it in a way that inspires their team to follow.

2. Trustworthiness: Leaders who inspire and motivate their team are honest, ethical and trustworthy. They foster an environment where people feel safe to express their ideas and concerns.

3. Empathy: Inspirational leaders are empathetic to their team's needs and feelings. They put themselves in their shoes and are able to understand and respond to their concerns.

4. Focused: Leaders who inspire and motivate their team have a laser focus on their goals and priorities. They are confident in their ability to achieve these goals and are able to communicate and inspire others to work towards them.

5. Courageous: Leaders who inspire and motivate their team are willing to take risks and make difficult decisions. They are not afraid to challenge the status quo and lead their team in a new direction.

6. Passionate: Inspirational leaders are passionate about what they do and are able to convey that passion to their team. They inspire others to do their best and are able to keep their team motivated and engaged.

7. Resilient: Leaders who inspire and motivate their team are able to bounce back from setbacks and challenges. They keep a positive attitude and are able to encourage their team to keep moving forward, even during difficult times.
